result.execSummary:
The defendant Charece A Yokofich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charece A Yokofich

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Received, signed and filed:
Order denying release privileges.
cab
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Kremers, Br. 36, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for Huber privileges (work and treatment release).

Defendant Charece A Yokofich in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Victim notified.
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 5 months as to each count in the House of Correction, consecutive,  with credit for -0- days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 15 months, concurrent,  with the following conditions:
- Complete parenting classes.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- Comply with all Children's Court orders.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Pay all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.

Defendant Charece A Yokofich in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Defendant failed to appear yester and the court issued but stayed a bench warrant until today's date.  Court withdrew the warrant.
Defendant wants to change her plea.
As to both counts:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 10/21/2015.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Molly Schmidt.  
cab
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 10/21/2015.

Defendant Charece A Yokofich in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The court is not in session today.
Case adjourned for a plea and sentencing date in Branch 36.
Agreed Upon Request for a New court date received and filed.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

If this case is not resolved, the jury trial has to be adjourned for another jury trial date.
cab

Defendant Charece A Yokofich in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense informs the court that they are remaining on for trial.  District attorney will be issuing additional charges.
Defense request to withdraw is denied by the court.
Defense requests another final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 36
Jury trial date set for 09/30/15 vacated.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called to address Jury Trial date. Branch 36 unable to hear Jury Trial on 8/26/2015. Matter rescheduled for Jury Trial on 9/30/15 at 8:30 AM in branch 36. Case remains set for 1:30 on 8/4/2015 for Final Pretrial in branch 36.  Jury trial scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

State brought forth a bail motion as to drug testing of the defendant by Justice Point. Discussion regarding Judge Kuhnmuench's prior order on 5/13/2015 that defendant be drug tested by Justice Point. Court received notice from Justice Point that based on the defendant's risk assessment and praxis score Justice Point would not test the defendant for drug use. State's motion to renew bail condition of drug testing of the defendant argued. Defense counsel advised the court that the defendant did not object to the bail condition, and that the defendant has voluntarily entered into de-tox and treatment with Genesis. At request of ADA Schmidt, Justice Point Program Direct Vicki Lupo appeared in court. Director Lupo advised the court and parties of Justice Point policy regarding drug testing of defendants. Director Lupo advised the court after further consideration Justice Point's decision remains, defendant will not be tested for drug use. For reasons stated on the record the court affirmed Judge Kuhnmuench's order of 5/13/2015 that ordered Justice Point test the defendant for drug use. The Court's order remains in effect, with the understanding that Justice Point per policy will not test defendant. Defendant advised even if Justice Point is not drug testing, that Absolute Sobriety is ordered by the court as a condition of bail.

Defendant Charece A Yokofich in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. State's offer is open to date of final pretrial. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 36.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, State's Response to the Defense Motion to Dismiss.
Received and Filed, Notice of Motion and Motion to Increase Bail Conditions.
Received & Filed, Letter from Justice Point: Rejection Notice advising the court that defendant has completed a risk assessment but does not qualify for supervision based on her low Praxis score.
Signed & Filed, Stipulation and Order Regarding Use of Videotaped Statements.
Court orders defendant REFERRED TO JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBREITY  to be monitored by drug testing. Defebndant ordered to report to Justice Point.

Defendant Charece A Yokofich in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
JUDGE KUHNMUENCH FOR JUDGE GRADY IN BRANCH 23
Bail motion by the state argued and granted by the Court. For reasons stated on the record, the court GRANTED the state's motion to included Justice Point Supervision and Drug Testing as a condition of bail. Case set for a Pretrial Conference at request of the defense counsel. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

State requests case be adjourned for bail hearing to address monitoring

  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 05-13-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As an additional condition of bail:
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No drugs without a valid prescription

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with M.M.   AND/OR    D.D.    AND/OR   D.D.    AND/OR   D.D.  unless as approved per Children's Court orders or if Children's Court is not involved, unless as approved and monitored by the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare

Court orders defendant to report for booking and release no later than 3:00 p.m. on 05-08-2015

Defendant Charece A Yokofich in court.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape#15-088

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 23 for a Pretrial Conference.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/7/15 @ 1:30pm
